name: Search Insert Position

similar_questions.title: Minimum Operations to Exceed Threshold Value I

title: Search Insert Position
content:
Given a sorted array of distinct integers and a target value, return the index if the target is found. If not, return the index where it would be if it were inserted in order.

You must write an algorithm with O(log n) runtime complexity.

 

Example 1:

Input: nums = [1,3,5,6], target = 5
Output: 2

Example 2:

Input: nums = [1,3,5,6], target = 2
Output: 1

Example 3:

Input: nums = [1,3,5,6], target = 7
Output: 4

 

Constraints:

  • 1 <= nums.length <= 104
  • -104 <= nums[i] <= 104
  • nums contains distinct values sorted in ascending order.
  • -104 <= target <= 104

discussion_posts.name: Movsar
discussion_posts.content:
The same as `binary search` but here `return leftPointer` at the end. 

**Time complexity:** *O(logn)*
**Space complexity:** *O1*

discussion_posts.name: AlgoEngine
discussion_posts.content:
